intro: Crataegus fructurubro, commonly known as the red-fruited hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its thorny branches, oval-shaped leaves, and showy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, red berries in the fall, which are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Crataegus fructurubro is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
